com.skobbler.ngx.positioner.logging
Class SKPositionLoggingManager

java.lang.Object
  com.skobbler.ngx.positioner.logging.SKPositionLoggingManager

public final class SKPositionLoggingManager
extends java.lang.Object

Handles logging the device's GPS positions to a file in different formats (log, gpx). ImportantImportant: After calling startLoggingPositions(String, SPositionLoggingType) , make sure you also call stopLoggingPositions() when logging should be stopped. Otherwise, GPX tags won't properly close and the saved file might be corrupted.

Version:
2.5

Nested Class Summary

Method Detail

getInstance

public static SKPositionLoggingManager getInstance()
Creates a single instance of SKPositionLoggingManager

Returns:

startLoggingPositions

public boolean startLoggingPositions(java.lang.String filePath,
                                     SKPositionLoggingManager.SPositionLoggingType positionLoggingType)
Starts logging device positions to a file at a specified path.

Parameters:
filePath - The path to a file ( with no extension ) that the logger will write in. The file will be created if doesn't exist.
positionLoggingType - The format of the logged positions ( GPX or LOG ). Based on this parameter, a proper file extension will be added to the file.
Returns:

pauseLoggingPositions

public boolean pauseLoggingPositions()
Pause logging to current file.

Returns:
success/failure.

resumeLoggingPositions

public boolean resumeLoggingPositions()
Resumes logging to current file, after a pause.

Returns:
success/failure.

stopLoggingPositions

public boolean stopLoggingPositions()
Stops logging to current file. This closes any GPX opened tags and closes the file. It's mandatory to be called, after a startLoggingPositions(String, SPositionLoggingType) call.

Returns:
success/failure.

addWayPointToCurrentLoggingFile

public boolean addWayPointToCurrentLoggingFile(SKCoordinate coordinate)
Adds a custom waypoint to the current logging file

Parameters:
coordinate - the custom object to be added . See SKCoordinate.
Returns:
success/failure.
